item.title: IMF Reform and Foreign Direct Investment
item.dc:creator: theadmin
item.description: This paper explores how a country’s engagement with an IMF-driven reform program influences foreign direct investment (FDI) firms’ decision to invest in that country.
item.content:encoded: This paper explores how a country’s engagement with an IMF-driven reform program influences foreign direct investment (FDI) firms’ decision to invest in that country.

item.title: Democracy and Dictatorship in Pakistan and India
item.dc:creator: theadmin
item.description:
In May of 2013, Pakistan saw its first smooth change of government following a general election since it gained Independence. In contrast, India has maintained a relatively stable democracy since 1947. How did two countries, which shared a colonial heritage and a few thousand years of history before that, see such different democratic trajectories? This [...]

Read More →
item.content:encoded:
In May of 2013, Pakistan saw its first smooth change of government following a general election since it gained Independence. In contrast, India has maintained a relatively stable democracy since 1947. How did two countries, which shared a colonial heritage and a few thousand years of history before that, see such different democratic trajectories?

This academic paper examines the empirical evidence behind several prominent theories of democracy and dictatorship in the context of Pakistan and India.
